title: Playwright MCP Configuration
description: Configuration schema for Playwright Model Context Protocol server

browserName.description: The type of browser to use

isolated.description: Keep the browser profile in memory, do not save it to disk

userDataDir.description: Path to a user data directory for browser profile persistence. Temporary directory is created by default

launchOptions.description: Launch options passed to Playwright browser launch

headless.description: Whether to run browser in headless mode

args.description: Additional arguments to pass to the browser instance

timeout.description: Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for the browser instance to start

contextOptions.description: Context options for the browser context

cdpEndpoint.description: Chrome DevTools Protocol endpoint to connect to an existing browser instance in case of Chromium family browsers

remoteEndpoint.description: Remote endpoint to connect to an existing Playwright server

port.description: The port to listen on for SSE or MCP transport

host.description: The host to bind the server to. Default is localhost. Use 0.0.0.0 to bind to all interfaces

saveTrace.description: Whether to save the Playwright trace of the session into the output directory

outputDir.description: The directory to save output files

allowedOrigins.description: List of origins to allow the browser to request. Default is to allow all. Origins matching both allowedOrigins and blockedOrigins will be blocked

blockedOrigins.description: List of origins to block the browser to request. Origins matching both allowedOrigins and blockedOrigins will be blocked

imageResponses.description: Whether to send image responses to the client. Can be 'allow', 'omit', or 'auto'. Defaults to 'auto', which sends images if the client can display them
